hook.text: In the 1960s, America decided to close its mental hospitals. Nobody planned what came next.

buildup.text: New medications and civil rights concerns made community care seem possible.

discovery.text: President Kennedy signed the Community Mental Health Act in 1963 to fund alternatives.

twist.text: The hospitals closed. The community centers were never fully built or funded.

climax.text: Hundreds of thousands ended up homeless or incarcerated instead of treated.

punchline.text: We emptied the hospitals but forgot to open the doors to care.

quiz.question: What was a major consequence of deinstitutionalization?
options: Many patients became homeless or incarcerated
